thread.title: Manchester United get early team news boost vs Watford
thread.title_full: Manchester United get early team news boost vs Watford

author: Stuart Mathieson
title: Manchester United get early team news boost vs Watford
text:
Sport Manchester United get early team news boost vs Watford Man United defender Phil Jones was absent at Leicester City but is planning to be back on Saturday Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get Manchester United FC   Thank you for subscribing!   
Phil Jones is set for to return for Manchester United against Watford on Saturday following another freak injury. 
The Reds defender had to limp off in the recent Old Trafford 0-0 stalemate with Hull City when his boot bust. 
Jones, who was enjoying one of the most injury-free periods in his six-year United career following his return in November from a knee injury, was forced him to miss the Reds' 3-0 win at Leicester City last Sunday. 
He is now fit and ready for selection when manager Jose Mourinho chooses his XI Watford. 
“It is all good now," Jones told MEN Sport. "I have just had a bit of bruising underneath the foot where my insole cracked and that was pushing up and it was just a bit painful. 
“It was just one of those things. You can't legislate for that. It could happen to anyone. It was just unfortunate it cracked. 
“But I should be okay for Watford.”
